utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who wants the last dumpling?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, a moment. We just had Thai food. In that culture, the last morsel is called the krengjai piece, and it is reserved for the most important and valued member of the group.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you all for this high honour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve seen pictures of your mother, keep eating.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, honey, if we’re gonna make the movie, we should go. This may be hard for you to hear, but when I say honey, I mean my fiancée. Yeah, well, now it means her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s okay if he wants to come.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. But next time, we get a sitter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, I got to go to work. I’ll walk down with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Uh, which is closer to the new train store in Monrovia, the movie theatre or the Cheesecake Factory?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Neither of them are close.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, well, then I guess it doesn’t matter which one of you drives me. Let’s play a fun guessing game to see who gets to take me. All right, this four-letter word describes either a printer’s type size or a compulsion to eat dirt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m not driving him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Penny, don’t give up, you can get this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aren’t you going with Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I have no interest in model trains, stores that sell them, nor their heartbreaking clientele.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I have some work to do, so…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can’t imagine that would disturb me. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Wouldn’t you be more comfortable at home?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not really, no.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All righty then. Guess I’ll just get started.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Leonard, please. I don’t need the running commentary.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Amy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you were reading.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was. Now I’m thinking about what I read. You all right, Leonard? You seem very uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Should I go? I’ve been told sometimes I overstay my welcome.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, who told you that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, most recently my gynaecologist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you stay as long as you’d like.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m glad to hear you say that, because I’m having a wonderful time. Hmm, I said the same thing to my gynaecologist.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What are you going to get at the train store, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not buying anything. They’re having a lecture. H-O gauge railroading. Half the size of O-gauge, but twice the fun. Very controversial topic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Which side do you come down on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll let you know after tonight. Unlike some people, I’m going in with an open mind. Who am I kidding? Of course we all know it’s O-gauge or no gauge.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can you believe grown men sit around and play with toy trains?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s pretty big talk for a man with a closet full of magic tricks at his mother’s house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: First of all, they’re not tricks, they’re illusions. And, secondly, when we get married, they’re all going up in the attic so you can have that closet for clothes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why would I keep clothes at your mother’s house?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, don’t think of it that way. Once we move in, it’ll be our house.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is she moving out?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why would she move out? It’s her house.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hang on. You seriously think I’m going to live with your mother?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, I think I can help here. Yes, Bernadette, that’s exactly what he thinks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why not? It’s a great house, plenty of room, and if we have kids, Mom’s there to help. You know, when she tells the Three Little Pigs story, she actually has hair on her chinny-chin-chin.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m not gonna live with your mother. Not now, not ever.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, someone obviously has some mommy issues.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj, take me home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t listen to her. Go to the movie theatre.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Take me home now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Movie theatre.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mmmmmm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, everybody calm down. There is a simple solution here. Raj, take me to the train store, and then I don’t care what you people do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How was your shower?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was good, good. Just out of curiosity, what time do you usually go to bed?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I’m up all night. I’m like a possum. Boy, you were not liked in high school, were you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not really. Is that my yearbook?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Dear Leonard, you’re really good at science. Maybe one day you’ll come up with a cure for being a dork.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it wasn’t spray-painting a lightning bolt on my briefcase, I can tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If it makes you feel any better, the only person who signed my yearbook was my mother.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Dear Amy, self-respect and a hymen are better than friends and fun. Love, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Well, you can add Jerry’s Junction to the list of train stores Sheldon Cooper will never set foot in again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Rough night, Casey Jones?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t know the half of it. It was billed as a lively give-and-take on the merits of model train sizes. But it was actually a set-up to intimidate weak-minded spineless rubes into buying H-O starter sets.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s in the bag?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it. But it’s not a spine,I’ll tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I had a delightful evening, Leonard. We should do this again sometime.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, sure. That’d be nice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Glad to hear it. I need someone to accompany me to the wedding of Dr. Moranelli and Dr. Gustufson this Friday. They’re kind of the Brad and Angelina of the primatology department.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you rather bring Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I would, but the last wedding we went to was a disaster. He behaved like a child the entire time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not my fault. You said there’d be other scientists there my age.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. You’re out, he’s in. No date to the prom, two dates to a wedding. Hmm, how times change.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ha-ha, you have to go to a wedding.

utterance.speaker: Howard (off)
utterance.content: I’ll get it!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Could you get it?

utterance.speaker: Howard (off)
utterance.content: I said I’m getting it!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll get it!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got it! Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey. I don’t want to fight. I was just surprised when you sprung the whole living-with-your-mom stuff on me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I’m sorry I didn’t run it by you first.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I don’t know who you’re talking to, but in or out! We don’t need bugs!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The bugs only come here because you’re their queen! Listen, how about this. Before we make any kind of decision about where we live, we have a trial run. Stay here for a weekend, see what it’s like.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And your mom would be okay with that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sure she would. Ma, do you mind if Bernadette stays here this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Hey, if she’s willing to give the milk away for free, who am I to say no?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: See? She’s good with it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Frankly, after all your sleepovers with the little brown boy, a girl is a big relief!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All this years, I’ve been so wrong. The tinier the train, the more concentrated the fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re a brain scientist. Can you explain to me why a brilliant man likes playing with toy trains?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not without cutting his head open, no. How about making my eyes like Cleopatra?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? For a wedding?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Perhaps you’re right. My cheekbones and beckoning pelvis already have a certain hello sailor quality to them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw. So handsome. Like James Bond.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Better than James Bond, because he’s tinier.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I got you this to give to me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, guests don’t normally wear corsages to a wedding. That’s more of a prom thing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I never went to my prom. My mom paid my cousin to take me, but he just used the money to buy drugs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Put the corsage on her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Amy, this is for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: When you’re done copping a feel, that goes on my wrist.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All aboard! Woo-woo! It’s official. I’m an H-O trainiac.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, dinner went nice.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I guess. Does your mother always cut your meat for you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Only when it’s fatty. Well, don’t be jealous, babe. Someday you’ll get to cut it for me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Bernadette! I found the extra head for the Waterpik if you want to use it!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m okay, Mrs. Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: You sure? I just squirted half a brisket outta my teeth!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Ma, how about a little privacy?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Oh, I know what that means! Hubba-hubba!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Relax, it’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Let me know when you’re done canoodling! Mommy needs a foot rub!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Would you like to dance?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, thank you. I’m really not much of a dancer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re not exactly winning any trophies as a conversationalist, either.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. The bride and groom seem happy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why shouldn’t they be? They have a feverish night of socially-approved copulation ahead of them. In some cultures, we’d stand outside of their bedroom cheering as they achieved orgasm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That sounds like a late night, and I have work in the morning, so…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Leonard, you may not have noticed, but I am being a delight here. And you’re not holding up your end of the evening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. This wedding just reminds me of my kinda-sorta girlfriend 9,000 miles away.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I have a kinda-sorta boyfriend who’s playing with a model train right now, you don’t hear me bitching about it. Leonard, a word of advice, moody self-obsession is only attractive in men who can play guitar and are considerably taller than you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not moody. I’m fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You have any evidence to support that statement?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, hey, I’m just as much fun as you are.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? Are you willing to draw a moustache on your finger as a conversational icebreaker? I am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, fine, what do you suggest?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We just had a lovely meal, the band is on fire, and you’re sitting next to a beautiful woman wearing whorish makeup. Why don’t we head outon the dance floor and see if I can sweat through these dress shields.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Once again, I, I’m really not much of a dancer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I’ll lead.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ready for bed?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. I need to brush my teeth, but your mother’s been in the bathroom for, like, an hour.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah, she sometimes has problems doing her business. Hang on. Ma, give up! Tonight’s not your night!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: You don’t know that! I just sat down!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, take a break! Bernadette needs to brush her teeth!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: She can come in and brush her teeth! I’m not embarrassed!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Problem solved.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, it’s not. I’m not going in there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, honey. She’s just sitting in there reading a magazine. You can’t see anything. I go in all the time.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Ha! The eagle has landed!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And we have splashdown. Wait here, I’m gonna go light a candle. And then we make passionate love.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There we go, last floor.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just can’t figure out what happened. I put my left leg in, I took my left leg out, I put my left leg in, and something just snapped.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The hokey pokey is a young man’s game.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I did have a great time. Thank you for reminding me it’s okay to have fun once in a while.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And also for breaking the head off the ice swan so I could hold it against my pulled groin.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I excel at spatial reasoning, and I had a hunch that the graceful slope of its neck would cradle your genitals nicely.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, okay. Again, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And again, you’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Want to come in, have a cup of tea?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, thanks. I’m gonna head home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Well, good night.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ames, hi. How was the wedding?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great. Until I accidentally made Leonard fall in love with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come in, let’s talk. Do you want a glass of wine?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wine is one of the reasons I’m in this fix. That and this dang pelvis.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry, what exactly happened?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The inevitable, he was lonely and vulnerable from missing his girlfriend, while I was charming, supportive and, let’s face it, in this dress, the perfect combination of Madonna and whore.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God, did he make a move on you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, but it’s only a matter of time. How could I have not seen this coming? Now I’m gonna have to break the little sad sack’s heart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sure he’ll be okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, Penny, much as I would treasure knowing that the two of us had been defiled by the same man, Leonard just doesn’t get my motor running.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, um, what are you gonna do? Do you want me to talk to Leonard, let him down easy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. I’ll let him have tonight. Then in the morning, I’ll send him an e-mail letting him know this body is never gonna be his wonderland. I mean, frankly, you’ve got a better shot than he does.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard. Check it out. I bought an N-gauge locomotive. Half the size of H-O. Look, it fits in my mouth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sounds like you had a great night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did. How was yours?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not bad. I had a lot more fun with Amy than I thought I would.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What exactly do you mean by that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it turns out she really knows how to help a guy loosen up and have a good time. Although, truth be told, my groin’s a little worse for wear. Ow! Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To send a message. She is not for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not for you!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good morning, handsome.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Morning, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, it is, and you’re so pretty in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Your mom and I made you breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, wow. So you guys are getting along?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess. We’re very different people, Howard, so communication’s a little tricky.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Does he like the pancakes?!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (in a similar voice)
utterance.content: He didn’t try them yet!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is there any butter?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s butter-flavoured syrup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: So, what’s the word?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He wants butter!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: It’s butter-flavoured syrup

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just told him that!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t need any butter.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you want butter, I’ll get you butter.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I guess I’ll cut these by myself.
